title: Spring force - block submerged in water

content.question: A block hangs at rest from a spring, stretching the spring to length <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math>, as shown in the left figure. The block is then completely submerged in a tank of water and comes to rest, as shown in the right figure. It is observed that, with the block in the water, the spring’s length is less than <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math>. Which of the following correctly indicates why the spring’s length decreases when the block is submerged?

choices.label: There is an additional force exerted on the block.

content.answer: There is an additional force exerted on the block.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
